greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerators in the Fibonacci (or rabbit) ordering of the positive rational numbers.
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..6000
example: The numerators are read from the rationals listed in "rabbit order":
mathematica: z = 13; d[s_List, t_List] := Part[s, Sort[Flatten[Map[Position[s, #] &, Complement[s, t]]]]]; g[1] = {1}; g[2] = {2}; Do[ g[n] = d[Riffle[g[n - 1] + 1, 1/g[n - 1]], g[n - 2]], {n, 3, z}];  (* Edited by _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 30 2018 *)
j[1] = g[1]; j[n_] := Join[j[n - 1], g[n]]; j[z];  (* rabbit-ordered rationals *)
program: (PARI) A226081_vec(N=100)={my(T=[1], S=T, A=T); while(N>#A=concat(A, apply(numerator, T=select(t->!setsearch(S, t), concat(apply(t->[t+1, 1/t], T))))), S=setunion(S, Set(T))); A} \\  _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 30 2018
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, May 25 2013
